caption: Absolutely one of my favorite DC restaurants for many years.  Great food and atmosphere.  Highly recommend.
Amazing service and great food! Would definitely come back!

Quality not as expected for price.  When you go to a restaurant this pricey, I think the experience should be exceptional.  I would likely have given it four stars in a mid-price point, but here it's just three.  The staff was quite lovely.  The food was not hot, but merely warm.  None of the flavors were particularly complex or impressive, and the most memorable were the duck for having too much vinegar and the chocolate and cherry mousse for tasting like a children's chewable cherry Tylenol.  This restaurant gave me the impression of having been quite the thing ten or twenty years ago, and you could safely take your older parents/grandparents here and they would be delighted.  But I'd choose somewhere else for me.
This place offers wonderful service as well as delightful meals. My favourite spot in the city. The food came out rapidly and the rates are affordable. Will definitely recommend this spot.

Love this restaurant. Service is always on point. The food is served as a custom tasting menu, wine pairings can be put together on request. The dishes rotate so the menu is never stale, and they're executed to a level of perfection that you'd expect from a Michelin restaurant. This is a dining experience not just a restaurant with good French cuisine.
Amazing service and food

Marcel’s, how we’ve missed you! This has been a grueling 8 months for lovers of fine dining. Take out is fine but can’t replace that luxurious feeling that a very professional staff (both front- and back-of-house) will see to it as a duty that you have a lovely and memorable evening. Our party arrived for the early dining option and was seated at a table laid just for us. We chose the outdoor seating and the space was charming and comfortable. The jaunty Veuve Cliquot umbrellas were cheery and helped give the space an intimate feel. Attractive fire pits and large propane heaters kept us warm and cozy. Vinnie and staff took excellent care of us throughout the meal. After months of take out cartons, we nearly swooned over the truffle-topped amuse bouche. Thank you, Chef! Every dish and every course was delightful and spot-on. My advice: if you are feeling down and tiring of this slog to the other side of the pandemic, treat yourself and your loved-ones to a wonderful evening of being cosseted and fed a succession of delights.
The meals are flavorable and the team is generous and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we pass a pleasant evening.  highly recommended.

From the first moment  you enter this restaurant  team give you an excellent feeling. Very courteous crew, it is a happy place to to go out with your friends or with your date. Great  food, creative  chief cook and stuff, comfortable  pay and courteous  service. Warmly recommended.

We enjoy hanging out. Last night we came to this delicious restaurant which we didn’t know before. We passed a lovely time there with exceptional dishes and a professional crew and a great  cuisine. We  added this venue in our phone list  and we will no doubt come back soon.  Highly recommended.

I've been here several times, sometimes for special occasions and sometimes just because, and every visit has been truly special. The service is impeccable and you really can't go wrong with the menu. The boudin blanc in particular is not to be missed. In more normal times, Marcel's has car service for taking you to the Kennedy Center if you have a show after dinner. This is already awesome, and the driver has in the past also brought us back to the restaurant for a nightcap afterwards, thus demonstrating how above and beyond the service goes!
The food was so savory. Quick and friendly service. It has a good interior. Feeling here is similar to a cafe in San Jose I liked.
We had a fantastic time at this spot. We liked the fantastic ambience and the menu. The staff members are super welcoming. I’m glad we finally managed to visit here.
They offer a nice range of fresh food. I liked eating here. Employees are always very kind, pricing is convenient and the spot is always clean.

Wow - was in the mood for a new place serving French food and Yelp suggested Marcel's.  It's in one of my favorite parts of DC.  Turns out I've been by it many times in prior trips... The experience was just what you'd expect from a place that understands that service is key.  They brought out the dishes on silver platters - felt really special.  It was a Wednesday and the dining room was almost full.

Went there for my birthday. Everything was amazing! There was always an element of surprise in each dish, for example the essence of brioche with your foie gras, that brings the dish together completely. The quantity was just right for us, and we ordered the 5-plate course, which allows you to choose any dive dish from the entire menu. I think that system is great, and look forward to enjoying his artful creations.

Poor customer service, we went there to celebrate a birthday and they were running out of some items on the menu, one of our friends was wearing casual clothes so we were send straight to the bar. Which type of hospitality service is this? When the restaurant was empty  we went there to dine in and sustain a local business instead we were welcome with attitudes and looks from the the tips of our toes to the top of our hairs. We were told they did not have steaks which we wanted but when we told them we were trying to order four courses they immediately change their attitude and try to accommodate. They probably thought we couldn't afford them since one of the guys in charge send us to Ruth's steakhouse for the "steak we were looking for". Really poor manners from both the bartender and the managers when approaching the table, you could feel the animosity for no reason but the outside looks.
Very good food and very good service. I got the house of joy beef along with the lemon chicken and both were good. Can get busy on the weekends.
Get the tasting menu you won't be sorry
Our favorite place for fine dining for special occasions in DC. We can always rely on great food and great service.

I love this spot! They offer good food, their menu is large, The chief cook in that spot is well trained, I love a lot eating all their food. The food is always fresh, the attitude towards the visitors  is friendly. I often eat in this place and I was never disappointed. I recommend this place.
We did not know what to expect as this was our first visit. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Thank you!
I eat here a lot since I work in the area. I must say the service is always great and they keep the spot well kept all the time. Prices are reasonable and they serve generous portions.
Had a very good experience here with my kids. The food was served fast and the service is just good. Prices are reasonable.
Food was great, but somehow the atmosphere was not so comfortable.

I told my friends about this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are flavorable and the team is generous and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we pass a pleasant evening.  highly recommended.

Was great. Pricey obviously but we know that going in. Only complaint is that my dates duck was room temp/borderline cool. Mine was hot but they brought it at diff times cause of what we ordered. She liked the bite of mine but was disappointed with hers. Other than that it was a super pleasant experience.

I meet friends in this great restaurant from time to time! This is my favorite place to to have a good dinner.  I go there at least once a month. The meals are great, the workers are courteous and the cost is fair. I like meeting in this place over a decent supper.
My partner and I each enjoyed a six-course tasting menu with wine pairing and it was absolutely marvelous. One of the best meals I have ever had. Each bite was savored, and will be remembered.
One of the best meals ever. The attention to detail was unprecedented, fantastic cuisine. Everything was delicious!

Table of 4 at 7:30 on the 23rd of December.  It was not packed when we got there, but later in the meal we were told that tomorrow, Christmas Eve would be terrible and we were thanked for eating now rather than tomorrow.  Food was spectacular, in particar the Venison Chop with Huckleberry sauce.  Service was impeccable; water re-filled within 2 minutes, chitchat with the Sommelier and waitstaff was pleasant and they were even humming along to the festive music, a cute plus.  I wholeheartedly reccommend Marcel's to any who have a finer taste for food, as well as those who are curious as to what a step up in the culinary world entails, as every menu item was masterfully described to us when we had questions.  (Valet parking is a huge plus in a busy city such as DC)

Jonathan Crayne is delightful. My wife and I celebrated our 30th at Marcel's and everything was equal to the celebration. Chef Robert and team delivered creative and delicious small plates on all five courses. Senior Captain Jonathan led a team that surrounded us with some of the best service we have ever experienced. Joanthan perfectly paired three wines with our courses, and throughout the evening provided a masterful blend of information, humor, and service. Tom Sietsema ranks Marcel's in his DC Restaurant Hall of Fame. Chef Robert and his staff richly deserve this ranking. We look forward to our next dining experience at Marcel's.

Went here on Saturday night. We asked our concierge at the Regis if business casual was appropriate attire and they said that they had never heard of  Marcels but that our attire (open-collar button ups and dress pants) should be more than sufficient for any establishment. The help at the restaurant seemed like we dressed up enough, but I would have felt more comfortable in a jacket. The food and drink, however, was just not that great. We ordered a bottle of wine, and when they brought it out, we found out it was a screw-off cap bottle! Not a corked wine.... and the food was just as mundane. The first couple courses were small, which is to be expected, but they were also just not exciting or stimulating. We all got room-temperature scallops on the fourth course and that was the last straw. Our bill was 600 for three people, and they did add gratuity to the bill (which was also expected). We left, and they had their driver take us to a second much cheaper and better restaurant. I think this place just puts too much of their “brand” into the pretentious atmosphere they have going on. In the end, it’s really just not that impressive.
5 stars all the way with old school elegance!
Amazing service, ambiance and food
it was too late to go in and inconvenience the staff, but they were very kind and offered and encouraged us to dine [it was too late] they gave us copies of the menu so that we may return

My hu@band and I went there last month to celebrate our 35th anniversary. It was a god choice. The atmosphere was special and the food was very good. The waiter even took several nice photos of us with my camera. Recommend highly for those special occasions as well as for the more casual ones.
A nice quiet place to enjoy amazing food and service. A little on the pricey side but worth it.
Lovely

My favorite restaurant in DC.  The food is absolutely delicious, the attention to detail is incredible, and the service it friendly and attentive.  Jonathan is wonderful, always there with a smile, ready to make our night a special one. If he isn't there, the manager will take care of  making your experience an amazing one.  Highly recommend a reservation.  You will not be disappointed.  They offer valet for easy parking or you can take an UBER and enjoy the wine!

Fantastic romantic restaurant with piano music if you want to impress your date this is the place.Great fast  service , nice friendly people. Food was made by artists more to feed your eyes and your ego than stomach.  I ordered steak rare to medium rare but I got well done. My boyfriend had scallops but they were over salted.  No worries about calories from the dessert you will need monocular to find it on the plate.  🤭 Only big what we got was the bill. $210 + tip  for bread with butter, 2 meals, 2 dessert, 1wine and 1vodka tonic. It was a great learning experience for me . I love a great food but I prefer great taste instead great look. ....Thank you very much.
Great food created by a great chef!!
My only complaint is for the potions (deducting one star). However, everything was amazing from the waiters to the deco and food was delicious. Am not easy to impress.

Exquisite dining experience. We chose the theater menu and were not disappointed. Great ambiance, fantastic wait staff and a delicious meal. They were aware of our engagement at the Kenned Center and were right on time. Fantastic wine list to choose from.

I dined at Marcel's on June 16th, 2019. After having just spent a semester in France, I wanted to recreate the authentic French dining experience. Marcel's was the perfect choice. The food, ambiance and service were otherworldly. Without a doubt, I would recommend Marcel's.

Incredible service, food, and drink. My entree was honey glazed duck, served medium rare, and it was the best duck I've ever had. Attached is a photo of their Bee's Knees—a very smooth drink with a not unexpected, yet wholly welcome, addition of lavender.

I had dinner with friends at this very expensive, outstanding restaurant. I have been to Marcel’s several times over the years and have always enjoyed my meal. I was apalled last night at how ordinary the food was at a cost that almost knocked me out of my chair. Soft shell crab was overly battered and greasy and tasted like fried food and not at all like crab. The halibut was a small dry salty piece of fish that again, had very little fish flavor because the salt, infused into the fish, was so overwhelming. My dessert was a small piece of blue cheese with some tiny accompaniments which were interesting but did not warrant the price tag of the meal. Overall, I was completely disappointed. Because I was with friends who are very taken with the restaurant, I was not able to speak up and offer my observations. I think my relationship with Marcel’s is over.  over.
Good service

This is one of DCs finest restaurants, if you can afford it, and not many can. We tried the 7 course tasting menu and it was spectacular. Each bite exquisitely crafted, perfectly prepared, plated like fine art.  The butter poached lobster and the venison chop were to die for.  Service was excellent, Vinny our server was very professional, but also fun, explained each of our courses perfectly.  Again, if you can afford it, you really should try it.

Food was very good, but do not waste your money on the wine pairing. The champagne to start was excellent (Dom Pérignon), but after that it was cheap wine after cheap wine. A quick google search revealed each glass poured came from a bottle between 17 and 25 dollars. Completely disappointing—especially for 160/person.

(Translated by Google) It's unclear whether it was Italian or French or American, but it does not seem to matter because the ingredients and the food itself are delicious. Amount is sufficient and price is not too expensive  (Original) 이탈리안인지 프렌치인지 미국식인지 좀 불분명한거 같지만 재료와 음식자체가 맛이 있어서 그런건 중요하지 않은듯합니다 양도 충분하고 가격도 너무 비싸지 않음

Everyone we encountered here was so professional and solicitous. I was quite pregnant at the time we ate here, and they made sure I had the most comfortable seat and even offered me a little pillow for my back. They were eager to help and very capable - making sure nothing was in the dishes that pregnant women shouldn't eat. The food was, of course, fantastic. We had a great last pre-baby night out.
The best restaurant ever. Period.
Jonathan is the best, the food is also great.
Expensive and disappointing
Impeccable service, luscious food and classic surroundings are the best descriptions I can use to describe Marcels.
Service and dining experience was great. As for the food I wasn’t impressed. Oh and my black widow drink was good.

Simply outstanding. The food was incredibly good and the service was exceptional. Our server pointed us in the right direction given dietary restrictions and made our night memorable. I'm grateful to have had this experience.
When you need to dine and not risk being disappointed. Excellent!
The service is unprecedented.  We enjoyed the 7 course tasting, every dish was unique and inspiring.
Food, Wine, Service all excellent. Approached a perfect meal.
nice place thank you
Excellent service and food.  Perfect birthday dinner!
Atmosphere is outstanding, and Jonathan, their Senior Captain made the experience of eating there even more memorable! Highly recommend eating at MARCEL'S.

Wonderful experience. Lovely atmosphere, excellent food; the staff were knowledgeable and attentive, yet unobtrusive; we never had to wait long throughout the chef's tasting menu but never felt rushed.

There is a reason Marcel's is the best restaurant in DC. As per usual this institution did not fail to impress.  we left our dinner choices up to the chef's whim. The wine last is carefully curated and interesting.  I look forward to visiting again when next I find myself in Washington.

I'm a foodie and I have eaten at many fine establishment with jole robouchon as my favorite. This place has a great staff and wonderful service. The food is delightful and delicious. To eat at another place is doing a disservice to your palate. Eating here is a must when eating in DC. Do the chef tasting!

This place was amazing! I'm not someone who is used to fine dining, so I am very bias. However for a regular guy taking his mom for a special birthday dinner, we had a great time.  Food was great (most recommend the scallops! To die for).  Service was excellent (very patient with my family and I who are very new to fine dining).  Seating was nice with a classy and elegant ambiance.  To answer some questions: valet parking is $15  Not to busy, not overly crowded but conversations are difficult to keep within your table. I definitely was able to listen to others conversation no matter how quiet they were. This didnt bother me or my family but may bother someone else.
Amazing overall experience, great food, fantastic service with Mark.
Unique and delicious food and a truly enjoyable Chef's Tasting Menu, both in food and in presentation!
I loved it so much and the prices were amazing

I dined here for my anniversary on Dec 1.  We noted on the rsvp it was a special occasion.  We last ate here in 2012 so it had been 6+ years and we were excited to go back.  I think they had a remodel and some changes since them based on my recollection of the 2012 experience.  For the price and reputation, we were packed in like sardines on top of other couples. That particular atmosphere takes away from the 3.5 hour experience.  You can't have private conversation and you just have everyone else looking at your table as dishes slowly come out... or you are looking at them.  Essentially what this does for the chef's tasting menu the element of surprise is taken away as you see what the other couples are eating who may be an hour or so in front of you.  We felt ignored at times - waiter didn't ask for drink orders for a while.  Had to pull teeth for attention.  Different waiters would provide the dish...might not get the full description when they place it front of you.  The food was just OK and the service was OK at best. The salmon roe amuse-bouche was really good. That was the best thing of the evening.  The lobster first course with caviar was A+.  It went downhill after that though.  The venison was over seasoned. The lamb was over cooked.  Over all, I am forgetting a couple courses just a couple days later so that should tell you something. Not positive memories.  The experience in 2012 was much better. The pumpkin dessert was just bad.  I won't be back.

The food here is delicious. The place is a little overpriced but it’s worth it. The service is great, the ambience is pretty and the food is tasty. Great place for an occasion. Went here for my birthday. We did a tasting menu. The plates were small but we liked everything we had.
Great food. Great service.
Great food.  Very accommodating staff.
Very professional personnel as expected, very simple design, but amazing food. Recommend it for a romantic night.
Delicious food presented like art, incredible wine selection, and phenomenal service. A total, complete experience.
Had an incredible anniversary meal there. Still the best in the city for pairing wines with the courses.
Food and service was around what I expected going in, however the price point was disappointing. Have had better testing menus for less. Overall a good experience though.
Delicious dinner of soft shell crab and snapper and salmon flowed by cow's milk cheeses and a truly unique vanilla cheese cake. Our server, Jonathan,  was superb.
Fine french cuisine. Excellent service and notable wine menu.

Before enjoying Hamilton both times I dined before the show at Marcel’s.  Gents, you must wear a jacket; ladies, just look good!  For dinner, to ensure you are out on time to arrive at the Kennedy Center in a timely manner, I highly suggest the pre-theater menu.  Not only are the portion sizes perfect and the food divine, it is also reasonably priced at $68 per person for three courses.  I have enjoyed the pre-theater dinner menu twice, and would probably enjoy it each and every time!  Even in three weeks, the menu did change slightly and I was able to enjoy different entrees and desserts.  The amuse-bouch was a watermelon and strawberry gazpacho.  It was refreshing, delicious and a very nice fusion of flavors.  Perfect for summer!  Both times I enjoyed the pan-seared scallops for the appetizer.  They are juicy, perfectly seared, the flavor of the sauce is light and well-balanced.  I have enjoyed two entrees and both were AMAZING!  If you love beef and it is your first time dining here, please (PLEASE) order the slow cooked short ribs.  They are slow cooked half of the day, they are fork tender and melt in your mouth with each bite.  The second entrée I enjoyed was the pan roasted farm chicken with potato cake and tarragon beurre blanc sauce. Also, delicious.  The chicken was juicy and the sauce was simply amazing.  I also really enjoyed the potato cake.  I use left over mashed potatoes to make potato cakes and I thought I did a great job with purple onions, salt, papper and white cheddar. But this potato cake was powerfully flavored with scallions and gruyere cheese.  Oh, ok … I know how I am making my potato cakes next time!  I have also enjoyed two dessert options and I really enjoyed them both as they were quite different – sweet vs savory.  My first visit I enjoyed the marjolaine of hazelnut daquiose with white coffee gelato and praline cream.  It was decadent and just enough.  During my second visit, I ordered a cheese plate (north sea gouda, semi hard) which came with macadamia nuts and a honey comb.  Also, very nice.  I enjoyed both desserts with a glass of prosecco.  Finally, as a palette cleanser, I was served a small cracker with pistachio cream and blueberry.  Who knew those flavors went so well together!  It was the perfect ending to a great meal.
The food tasted a little like Popeyes chicken  I didn’t stay very long
Absolutely fantastic service, food, and atmosphere. Chef's tasting menu was delicious.
Great restaurant amazing food and service
Outstanding, wonderful food and attentive service
The food and service were amazing! don't know why they don't have any Michelin stars!
My favorite stop before going to the Kennedy Center. This "completes" the perfect night with a dinner delivered in perfect portions, car service to and from your show and a great experience.
We had the seven course tasting menu.  It was one of the best meals I have ever eaten.
Excellent food and attentive service, as always.
A truly amazing French Belgian fine dining experience just outside of Georgetown. Wonderful, friendly service in a very sophisticated environment. I recommend it without hesitation.
Uppity customers. Amazing service. Great food.
Excellent! !!!!

Went for the pre theater dinner. We’ve eaten at some of the top restaurants in DC, and this has by far been one of the best dining experiences of all time. From the friendly hostess, the knowledgeable server, the food and pairing recommendations, to Robert himself coming to serve us one of our dishes, we have never experienced hospitality like this in the city. As if that wasn’t enough, the staff arranged a car service to the Kennedy Center after our meal. The whole experience is like having everything go your way. Ever have one of those days? Well, go to Marcel’s, and you absolutely will.

Was late on a Saturday eve. We did not plan ahead. All the fine dinning had a hour or more wait. We came across Marcel's, and there was no wait. After eating there we know why. The service was bad. I had to send my steak back twice, and still wasn't done right. The sides were cold. The waiter could of cared less. Very expensive, which I wouldn't of cared if the food was good. Will never eat there again when in D.C. The location is good, but I would not recommend this place

MAGNIFICENT Marcel’s is a classic DC dining establishment that epitomizes the pinnacle of elegance and service. I love the restaurant has a JACKETS REQUIRED requirement for guests; a rare and welcome change to the flip flops and shorts found in other establishments. Staff was amazingly courteous, knowledgeable, and efficient, ensuring our service was excellent. We savored the three course fixed price menu offerings. Each dish was perfectly prepared, elegantly plated, and served at a relaxed pace. We will be back when we need our fix of elegant dining!!
Great service by Chris. I did the 7 course meal, this is what small plates were meant for! I was very full at the end. Great food and very satisfying.
Can't wait to return!  Every morsel is a delightful memory! Can't say enough about the service,  ambiance and menu.
Superb service and excellent meal. Always a pleasure to dine here
Excellent service and exceptional food.
(Translated by Google) Very good atmosphere, professional attention and excellent dishes  (Original) Muy buen ambiente, atención profesional y excelentes platos
Delicious dinner. Enjoyed Chef Robert's company. Service was on point

My favorite spot in DC.  Very surprised this restaurant keeps being left off of the Michelin guide.  It is definitely the guides bias towards “new” American and “new” European + Asian spots.  Either way, this place is classic and the food is spot on.  Significantly better than a two star spot (aquavit) I ate at in NYC this week.  Service was great.  Vibe was great.  Prices were right for what this place was.  I come back year after year and will continue to do so.
No better dinner in DC
Spectacular dinner, wonderful ambiance and great service.  Worth every penny for a nice dinner out.

Marcel's continues after more than 20 years to be our favorite restaurant in DC. Imaginative menu, attentive and thoughtful service and an overall sense of "this is how we do it." Warmth and sincere interest in the clientele unlike we see in even the best establishments in the DC area.
Superior service and excellent food.
Food was delicious, service impeccable. A memorable evening.

The food and service was superior. Presentation was great. The menu was very diverse as well. The restaurant doesn't seem to get busy until maybe 8 or 8:30 but even when it was busy the atmosphere was still very peaceful and you felt like you had privacy.  Also they had a pianist playing live music from time to time and it was amazing.  This a great experience for a special occasion I would recommend to anyone.
A deeply satisfying dining experience. Awesone staff!
Marvelous. Can go toe-to-toe with the best restaurants in DC.
Always very good and usually excellent
Amazing!
Great food. Great service Always a culinary adventure
Champagne was delicious

We had the "Pre-Theater" recommended menu.  It was AMAZING!  Chef Robert paid us a visit at our table.  His personal touch gave us a sense of authentic culinary mastery.  We generally ordered his recommendations and every course was delicious!  The service exceeded expectations.  We made our show with a few minutes to spare.  Robert!  We'll be back soon!!  P.S. the creme brûlée was the very best I've ever had!!
Amazing service - the ultimate special occasion venue 🍾💋
The whole experience was excellent! And being able to pick from all the courses to be any one course - very unique.

This is the second time we have been to Marcel's, and it has won our hearts. The food it beyond amazing, and the service is that of excellence. Everything on the menu is delicious. There are no mediocrity options here. Come, spend time, and enjoy.
Outstanding service outstanding food
Every course was amazing!
One of the best ravioli

When we were picking a place to catch a nice dinner before a Kennedy Center show, Marcel's kept coming up on the very top of review lists, and after our first trip here this week, I can definitely see why.  The dining room is spacious, comfortable, and well-lit without being harsh (fantastic that you can actually see your food, since the presentation is so attractive).  I'd requested the pre-theater menu, which is a selection of 3 items for each of 3 courses plus the option to have a private car drive your party to the theater after dinner.  The menu was about 50% different from the sample theater menu posted on the website, but I had the exact same problem with both versions - I literally wanted to try every item on there.  Between our party of 4, we did order almost everything on the theater menu.  My friend thought her steak was a little too tough, but each other dish was an absolute rave from all of us (the duck confit was devastating).  Our wonderfully attentive waiter happened to be an excellent sommelier, and flawlessly selected wines for each course for those of us interested in doing so.  When we were done, a  town car was waiting out front to drop us off at the front door of the Kennedy Center, right on time for the show.  My partner asked to look at the full menu as well "just to see," and we immediately decided we'd be back soon - again, everything sounds fantastic.   Highly recommended!

Easily a 2 Michellin Star Restaurant!  I stumbled upon Marcel’s by mistake. My wife and I had guest finished seeing a show at the Kennedy Center, and were looking for a place to eat. Being new to DC, I made a reservation at Jardenia, across the street from Marcel’s.  As soon as we got to Jardenia, we were disappointed. It was hard to find a host, the chairs were incredibly comfortable, and the menu was boring. It was a disappointment after a fantastic evening of listening to great music. A quick google search and I found Marcel’s across the street and was hoping they could squeeze us in.  I explained by plight to Jonathan, the very charismatic manager that greeted us, and he managed to find us a table. From the moment we sat down, everything was a delight. Jonathan sent us over a couple of glasses of excellent rose champagne and took the time to explain all the great choices on the menu.  The service was impeccable, and the food was absolutely superb. I consider myself a NYC food snob that often frequents Per se, Le Bernardin, Daniel, and Eleven Madison Park. Marcel’s was as good than those restaurants, if not better, in many respects. The waiters were professional, the timing of the plating was on point, and the ambience was that great mix of old world serenity with modern touches.  The food was sublime, with a great mix of traditional and new flavors. My wife has the lobster bisque which was easily the best I have ever had and my scallops were seared to perfection. My lamb tenderloin was tender and succulent and my wife’s fish was crispy and flavorful. The chocolate soufflé was the perfect topping to an amazing meal.  Jonathan was so hospitable, I told him that moving from Jardenia to Marcel’s was like getting upgraded from the middle seat in United to British Airways First Class. The place was a delight and we will be back – a lot.
Incredible food! The service was excellent. They have a wide selection of wines from 16$
Excellent food, service and pleasant decor! Pricey!
Great pre-theater menu and a limo service to the Kennedy Center.
Wonderful meal and great service. Special birthday event that created many good memories .
The bar is fantastic: waiters, ambience, food,  cocktails and both the bar and restaurant menus.

The food is always creative and outstanding.  Jonathan always guides us to the perfect dining experience.  The bar is always welcoming and has so many great choices. Robert thank you for making us feel welcome.
Ambience is good but the food could have been better.

My favorite restaurant in DC and I love that Michelin has not discovered it yet. Can't stand restaurants with gimmicky reservation open times (exhibit A: pinneapple and pearl) Or deposits for reservations  (exhibiy B: fiola). Marcel is pure delight, from reservation, to service, to special requests and of course the food. The menu changes regularly, but on our latest visit we loved everything we ordered. On our "must-have" list is mussels gratin, the venison, the dover sole, the panna cotta and the esspoise cheese. On our "optional" list is the sea bass, lamb triangles and lemon merengue. We noticed everyone ordered the Lobster bisque, must be good. The service, always impeccable, but my favorite part is the upbeat and helpful Jonathan who was the "captain" of service for our table. Adnan at the front of the house always goes above and beyond too. The ambiance, we have found, is quieter in the lower level... so thats where we like to sit.
Wonderful service, and warm welcoming ambience, with delicious Belgian-French fare, we'll visit often
Always great food and service.
Best french in DC
Everything was perfection - the food, the service, the ambiance.
Wonderful service and the food is absolutely amazing. The staff was delightful and very accommodating with my food allergy. Best filet mignon I've ever had.
Gourmet but not stuffy. You can start with dessert, have 4 entrées - whatever you like in any order. Delicious food, excellent service, valet parking.

Great food and service! My wife had tickets to the Kennedy Center and a co-worker told her about Marcel's prefix dinner and ride to and from the Kennedy Center. Since parking is always an ordeal we opted for the food and ride. We were delighted with the service and food. The restaurant itself has a bar and dinner tables but felt very refined. The menu was intriguing with items such as cantaloupe soup and hanger steak. Definitely worth trying out if you want to have a nice dinner. I recommend jacket and tie for gentlemen and a nice dress for the ladies.

Don't go there, they ripped me off. The reception was bad, the so-called french host is not, I beleive he is Lebanese,  the plates are so small, but the price over the top. My wife and I went there last night, we were extremely disappointed. They have their clientele,  if you are an outsider,  you feel that you are not welcome. I have been travelling all over the world and beleive me this restaurant is exagération of pricing for the quality. I took a ravioli with meat sauce,  only 8 pieces, so small,  but the price 45$. My wife took a small blueberry cake, for 22$. This is ridiculous. The menu is for a 5 to 7 courses, at $$$$, During our diner,  the host was always snobys us talking behind our back to their staff. Very bad atitude, I am telling you don't even go there. My name is Roger and you can reach me any time to discuss.
Fabulous.  Fantastic Belgian cuisine.  Best restaurant in DC.

My wife and I celebrated our anniversary dinner last night at Marcel's. We were the first ones in the door at 545PM. We each had the four course meal which includes three savory dishes and one dessert. It was truly the best meal I have ever had. We had Jonathan Crayne as our waiter. He is the senior captain of the group and he is the nicest, most professional waiter I have ever had. If you are celebrating a special occasion, then take my advice and request to be seated at Mr. Jonathan's table. You will not be disappointed.

We went with friends for Valentines Day.  The prix fixe was expensive, but not nearly as expensive compared to the $105 charged for three glasses of champagne before the meal..  We asked only for a glass of champagne but obviously got the top of the line.  Even so, $35 a glass is ridiculous.  Also, the service was slow and we had to flag our waiter to order after sitting for 15 minutes.  Perhaps they were hoping we'd order more champagne??
Food is okay. Service needs improvements. I have to  say that you can easily find a restaurant serving better food in Paris.
Excellent food and classy atmosphere

My wife and I chose to go to Marcel's based on a 4.5 star rating here on Google. However, we were quite disappointed at the rudeness of the waiter. For the money, of course we expected high quality of food which was not too bad (my wife rated the food higher than me; I think it was OK too, though not outstanding). At first we found that the waiter got a running nose and so he made some noise trying to breath in something in his nose. As time went, we found that he seemed to have forgot to refill water for us. My wife guessed that maybe he was not happy with my dressing since I did not wear a suit, just business casual for this top restaurant. But at least we were polite as usual to him. Then when I asked for the bill, he asked me if I want him to add 20% tips. What a blatant request! But I did pay 20% after-tax tips to indicate that I am not a mean person. I also usually pay 20% tips. Maybe he just look down at some people after figuring out some factors to look down? Anyway, it is just my guess and I am not sure about the reason. But I am pretty sure that he was quite rude by asking for 20% tips after even failing to refill water for a long time.
been there about 5 times and it has not disappointed.  service is great and food is even better.

excellent ! food was wonderful our waiter was the best waiter I have ever had. he was attentive informative funny. my overall experience was amazing. I love love love this restaurant. ive been to plenty 5 star restaurants but this one by far is worth trying!
We were planning on going there for dinner and my wife fell and broke her foot so I called them from the hospital and asked for to go and the manager was so kind to let me get to go order.

Four of us had a very nice meal here on a Saturday night.  Food was wonderful, but the service a little inattentive (hence 4 vs 5 stars). Our reservation was for 10pm; we showed up on time, but the table needed setting.  (Odd - there were quite a few empty ones).  We then sat for 45 minutes before our order was taken, and a further 15 before any food was brought.  Once it started, though, it came at a perfect pace. (Oddly, the front-of-house manager had apparently noticed the delay when we spoke on the way out, but didn't do anything about it.)  Our waiter was friendly enough - especially towards the end, when there was only one other table.  The menu consists of 7 courses of 3 dishes apiece; you get to pick from 4 -7 dishes from anywhere on the menu.  This made it easy for a couple of us to skip over the seafood-heavy first few courses; we were offered the chance of asking for a replacement vegetarian dish, but didn't need it. With two exceptions (the watercress soup and pear salad were both very salty) the food was executed nearly flawlessly.  Nothing stood out as a "wow" (except perhaps four a couple of the desserts), but it was all exceedingly good.  Portions were perfectly sized.  The wine pairings were wonderful, and included the chance to replace them with something else if they weren't to our taste.  (We did this for one of 20 glasses).  We did have to ask explicitly for the wine pairings to be brought at the beginning, but things got better later on, and pours increased in size towards the later part of the meal.  It's not cheap: just under $800 for 4 people, each with 5 courses plus a 4-course wine pairing, including tip.  But it was a special occasion ...

They did not respect the guest, I don't recommend it at all. There is employee his name is Adnan, he is a shame for that resturant. Hopefully This message  reach the duty  manger .  I never repeat my visiting again.
This is a fantastic restaurant, one of the best formal restaurants in DC.  Very good for special occasions.

I understand that food critics and chefs have a love and hate relationship.  I am neither of the two.  I am a diner, a guest, a patron.  Thankfully, some of the "know it all" food critics' opinions of restaurants don't carry much influence on me.  Instead, I rely on the online reviews by other guests.  I am glad Tom Sietsema came to his senses when he posted his recent review of Marcel's By Robert Wiedmaier.  I have enjoyed the restaurants such as, Inn at the Little Washington, Le Diplomate, Fiola Mare, Fiola, Komi, Oval Room, Oyamel, Vidalia, CityZen, Blue Duck Tavern, Bourbon Steak, Restaurant Eve, Zantinya.....and many more.  However, Marcel's is THE #1 place to go,  ALWAYS.  You are having an extraordinaire experience if you are enjoying a meal prepared by Robert, served by Jonathan and seated at table #25.  It is heavenly.  Take my word for it because I am not a "know it all" food critic.  Just a paying guest.

I dine out probably more frequently than I should and still find Marcel's to be the finest white table cloth restaurant in Washington.  The service is beyond comparison, outside of New York City there are no matches for Marcel's.  Trendy spots come and go while Marcel's is the steadfast winner in a sea of flashy new upstarts.  The feeling is 100% Washington with warmth and welcome.  Dining is an experience of labor and perfection, succulent feathered friends, delectable meats bursting with flavor, gifts from the sea and all prepared so well and presented so beautifully.  No deconstructed mysterious cubes of some such covered in foam and injected with butter, food at Marcel's is flavorful, delicious and perfectly prepared.  We had a wonderful celebratory dinner there this time with a fantastic flight of wine and fabulous service that makes Marcel's a very special place!
Great bar, food was excellent, and service was exceptional. I would go back.

I am puzzled by the glowing reviews that led me to visit this place.  Before you eat at Marcel’s, some preparation is in order.  Wear a coat with deep pockets or carry a bag…  so that you can take with you a couple of your favorite sandwiches, hot dogs, wraps, or whatever you like to eat when you are hungry.  You will be glad you did.  The meal philosophy at Marcel’s consists in offering a meal of up to 7 courses, each a meager portion, in the hope that it adds up to a decent meal, though they aim mostly at dazzling you with the sophistication of the food.  I thought that sort of dining experience had died with the nouvelle cuisine fad of the 80s and 90s, but it lives on at Marcel’s.  Each course menu description is a sonnet that promises untold delights.  When the food arrives, however, you see a few morsels over patches of colorful sauces and garnish so artfully presented that it compels you to take a picture of the dish before daring to touch it, almost.  A qualification is in order.  We live in the US but we were born and raised in Europe.  It means that when waiters usually place a family-size food tray trying to pass for an individual portion in front of us, we do not appreciate the excess, or the implication that we might be wolves.  On the other hand, I have eaten lots of hearty meals in France, and nobody should ever think that Marcel’s food is how the French well-to-do eat.  They serve ridiculously small portions, no exaggeration.  My foie-gras course ($36) was the size of a matchbox, a couple of polite mouthfuls at best.  Now this style of dining would have a chance if when you finish the few mouthfuls of each course, the next was on its way, but no; the intercourse wait was a painful 10-15 minutes, and there were six on schedule.  The food tastes very good and tantalizes you, but then you have to sit wanting for more what feels like a long time.  I asked the waiter if he could shorten the wait between courses, and he said he would ask the chef, but it was still a good ten minutes wait in between courses for the rest of the meal.   At the start of the meal a waiter brought five diminutive bread rolls and a plate with ovals of butter, each an extraordinary elaboration the size of an olive.  A magnifying glass would have come in handy.  If an avid restaurant manager or head-waiter were to keep the courses coming with a short wait between them the meal experience could improve substantially, but as it turn out it was a mighty annoyance.  We went to Marcel for our 10th anniversary, and instead of a memorable meal we had a memorable joke.  At least we can laugh about it.  One of my dishes was cold on arrival, and one of my wife’s dishes was much too salty. They deducted the cost of those and they gave me a free Sambuca, and the waiter did ask what he could do to salvage our meal experience, so he gets kudos for that, unfortunately, the mix of the restaurant philosophy and its bad implementation, limits what any waiter can do to compensate. We were going for the full 7-course meal but as we saw the miniature dessert and cheese courses other people ordered, we decided to cut it short and had just a 4-course meal.  I still paid over $200, for just the two of us, even with deductions and only two glasses of wine.  So it was a very expensive joke.  I don’t mind the cost so much it they give us a splendid dinner, but that was not it, and I wonder how this restaurant can survive in the US, with such hilariously small portions and the couple of hours that it takes to actually get the food on the table.  It shall remain a mystery, but I know that a New York style hot-dog stand nearby would have very good prospects.
The food is okay; The waiter is insolent: asking me where I am from, The waiter  rude: asking for 20% tip.

Hubby wanted a special dining experience for my birthday in February. Marcel's was the right choice. Jonathan made this a really special evening with suggestions and special treatment throughout our dinner. This meal is a show--the service is fantastic, and they take their french cuisine seriously. I would suggest that you come here for special occasions for a meal.

My husband and I chose Marcel's to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary, and we could not have chosen a more perfect venue.   As soon as we stepped through the doors, we were greeted with a warm welcome.   The atmosphere is classic but by no means stuffy.  Since we arrived a little early, we decided to have cocktails at the bar in the comfortable and inviting lounge.   Fantastic martinis!   All of the staff were impeccably dressed, energetic and charming.   Adnane, the Maitre D' was so gracious and greeted us with his congratulations and escorted us to our very special table.  During the evening, he came over a number of times to make sure everything was perfect, and it was.   Jonathan (Senior Captain) took our orders.   He was delightfully engaging, informative and fun!   The food was so wonderful...beautiful presentations, every morsel scrumptious.  Paul, the chef, is fantastic and he even took the time to extend his good wishes as well.   The service was first rate and the kindnesses extended to us were generous and genuine.  Thanks to all the staff at Marcel's for making our 50th wedding anniversary unforgettable.  We can't wait to return!

Perfect before a show at the Kennedy center! Who could ask for more? High end sexiness at it's finest and you must love chef Robert weidmaiers restaurants. The wine pairing here is stupendous! And chef de cuisine is the sweetest ever. Service is stellar. #dishcrawlapproved

With my date, a Frenchman, the experience was surely heightened. From the moment we stepped onto the sidewalk leading to the Marcel’s entryway, the experience started. Greeted with a “white gloves” style and grace, coupled with sense of recognition and expectancy (although we were late to our reservation-my fault), it felt like I had been greeted by an old friend awaiting my arrival.  Wine, Cote Du Rhone, food, multi-course meal – all impeccable and exquisite. From the fois gras, to the chocolate soufflé … heavenly. Absolutely heavenly.

Great tasting menu options with flexibility to make your own flow of courses. You can pick multiple dishes from 1 course section or mix and match.  I personally skipped the 4th or 5th course which was mainly meat dishes and had 2 fish dishes instead. Each dish showed a delicate balance of respect to traditional french style cooking and chef's own interpretation of the fine ingredients used. The overall dining room vibe is more on the traditional and classic side which complements the food it presents.

By far the best dinning experience ever if your looking to go to the Kennedy center to enjoy dinner and a show marcels theater menu is awesomee they make sure your schedule is held with comp trans to KC, and for new patrons I can tell you if your nervous to dine at a place as nice as marcels don’t be the staff is fantastic and helpful all the way and Rebecca thank you for making dinner with my wife a truly wonderful evening. jon & jeannette

I had the pre theatre menu before going to see the opera at the Kennedy Center. What a lovely and fantastic experience at Marcel's. Would recommend it to anyone who is going for a early evening show and would like a nice relaxing meal before hand.

Did dinner here, pre-theatre, for wife's birthday.  They made a personalised menu for her, and made it a special event.  Highlights: :: boudin blanc (!!); oysters :: Service -- just-the-right-amount of attentive; not pretentious at all (to our pleasant surprise); capped off with car-n-driver service to the Ken Ctr.  Highly Recommend!
Food was good, but nothing stunning. I see no reason to go back here - I feel like I experienced the sum of what their kitchen can pull off.
Absolutely outstanding experience! :) Always! :)
Impeccable. Among the top 3 or 4 dining experiences I’ve ever had. The 2-color asparagus soup with scallops was my favorite item.

Sit back, relax, and enjoy a most wonderful evening of attentive service and superb food.  The recent change to a "courses" menu with appetizer sized entres is wonderful; you get to sample even more of the wonders that come out of this kitchen from Chef Wiedmaier.  The wine list and recommendations are great.    I highly recommend the oysters & mussels gratine and the cheese plate.  Of course, the lamb in phyllo dough is succulent!  This isn't going to be cheap but you can reminisce for months about the dinner; for our party of four with drinks before,two bottles of $125 wine, and seven courses, our total tab was $900.  (While I have used their before-performance dinner, I much prefer to linger over a dinner at Marcel's.  Come here when you have no distractions and can really enjoy just the ambiance, the service, the food, and your company.)
Probably the best "old world" dining experience I have had in DC.  This is not casual, this is not "hip," but man it is good.

Easily our favorite restaurant, Marcel's keeps amazing its customers, even its regulars, year after year.  Robert Wiedmaeier's attention to detail and creativity show in every dish.  The staff are forever attentive and quickly bond with their customers.  Marcel's is even adept at the difficult task of feeding children and making them love their first big night out.
